revised_title: Climate, Vegetation, and Forest Limits in Early Civilized Times
tldr: This article explores the relationship between climate, vegetation, and forest limits in early civilizations. It examines how climate changes affected the distribution of vegetation and the habitats of various species, leading to shifts in the locations of early civilizations. The author also discusses the challenges faced by primitive societies in adapting to these changes and the role of migration in response to climate fluctuations.
